div1.p: Form No. 599 No 1204.
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs. Herbert O. Williams, and Grace E. Williams, Respondents.
O P I N I O N
Filed June 28, 190x A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk, By A. N. Moor, Deputy.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD, Petitioner, vs. HERBERT O. WILLIAMS and GRACE E. WILLIAMS, Respondents.

In this cause I hereby certify that the judgment of dis- missal herein made is based solely on the grounds that while the record herein shows a controversy, between a citizen of the State of California on the one hand and citizens of the State of Washington on the other still it does not show such a controversy, in my opinion, between citizens of different states, as will confer jurisdiction upon a Circuit Court of the United States, and that the declaration or petition, in my opinion, dis- closes the infraction of no right arising under or out of the Federal Laws of Constitution; and that treating the motion to dismiss as presenting the questions of jurisdiction, and acting also, independently of the motion, and on the courts own motion, the suit is dismissed only for the reasos above stated; that it that the cotroversy not being such between citizens of different states as to confer jurisdiction upon a circuit Court of the United States, and not being one aris- ing under the Laws of the Constitution of the United States, there is consequently no jurisdiction of the Circuit Court of the United States.

This certificate is made conformably to Act of Congress of Maarch 3, 1891, Chapter 517, and the opinion filed herein is made a part of the record and will be ccertified and sent up as a part of the proceedings, together with this certificate. This 25th day of A. D., 1904.
C. H. Hanford Circuit Judge.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT. DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD Pitioner Herbert O. Williams, etal Respondents.
Certificate that ground of decision was want of jurisdiction.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. OCT251904 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk A. N. Moor Dep.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NONTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD, Petitioner, vs. HERBERT O. WILLIAMS and GRACE E. WILLIAMS, Respondents.

The petition of Peter A. Clifford herein, having come on regularly for hearing before the court on the day of 1904 and the respondents above named having made and filed a motion to dismiss upon the ground and for the reason that this court had no jurisdiction in the premises and the court being of the opinion that it had no jurisdiction upon the facts stated in the petition herein and having filed its written opinion thereupon, and on said motion of said respondents and on its own motion ordered that said petition to be dismissed:

Therefore it is ordered and adjudged that the petition of Peter A Clifford in the above entitled matter be and the same is hereby dismissed and the order to show cause herein be and the same is hereby discharged.
C. H. Hanford Judge
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
Peter A. Clifford vs. H. O. Williams etal Order of dismissal Filed Oct 25, 1904 A Reeves Ayres Clerk By A. N. Moor Deputy
CERTIFICATE
United States of America Western District of Washington

I, JAMES C. DRAKE, Clerk of the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington, do hereby certify that the foregoing attached paper constitute the JUDGMENT ROLL in the foregoing entitled cause, No. 1204 wherein Peter A. Clifford Plaintiff and Herbert O. Williams etal Defendent
In Testimony Whereof, I have hereuntto set my hand and affixed the Seal of said Circuit Court, this the 26 day of DEC. A. D. 1911 JAMES C. DRAKE, Clerk.
By BOWright Deputy Clerk.
